page.title: 08Education in the village.
page.content: Unusually for a village of its size Ampleforth has two primary schools: St.Hilda's (C of E) and St.Benedict's (RC). Both schools take boys and girls. St.Hilda's has a few more children and therefore has one more full-time teacher. Neither school has a uniform. The school day begins at 9:00 a.m. and finishes at 3:30 p.m. The three R's, games, religion, art and music are taught. As the same teacher takes the class for the whole day the timetable is flexible. Both schools take children from a wide area. Most children from St. Hilda's go on to Ryedale Comprehensive wheras an increasing number from St.Benedict's go to the new RC All Saints Comprehensive school in York. One or two boys from both schools go to Ampleforth College as day boys.
